etymology.description: 江(江) (jiāng, "river") originally referred to the Yangtze River, and 湖(湖) (hú, "lake") represents a body of water. Together, 江湖(江湖) (jiānghú) forms a concept that refers to an elusive space beyond the structured society where martial artists, wanderers, and hermits dwell. In classical Chinese literature, it evokes a sense of the wandering, adventurous, and sometimes dangerous life outside societal norms.
etymology.interpretation: 江湖(江湖) (jiānghú) symbolizes a life free from official duties, inhabited by martial arts practitioners and those seeking adventure and freedom from societal constraints.

examples.chinese: 他闯荡江湖(他闖蕩江湖)，寻找自由(尋找自由)。
examples.english: He ventures into the martial world, seeking freedom.

examples.chinese: 在江湖之中(在江湖之中)，英雄辈出(英雄輩出)。
examples.pinyin: Zài jiānghú zhī zhōng, yīngxióng bèichū.
examples.english: In the martial world, heroes emerge one after another.
